ygData.subject: RE: Z-axis bug
ygData.msgSnippet: From: Talies the Wanderer  ... Arrows aren t spells, but I would say that a levitating archer would suffer from action/reaction and tumble
ygData.messageBody:
From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>

At 11:42 AM 8/7/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: "Michael Meadows" <meadows@...>
>
>The easiest and most sensible fix is to remove the z-axis code, and fix
>spell casters so they can't cast any spells while levitating. So they can
>either float away from danger, or get down on the ground and attack, but
>they can't have it both ways.
>
> Paralto of Povar

>>What about archers? <<

Arrows aren't spells, but I would say that a levitating archer would suffer
from action/reaction and tumble head over heels if he tried to shoot an
arrow when his feet weren't planted firmly on the ground.

>>What about weapon effects ("procing")<<

I don't get your point.

>>What about PvP duels?<<

I don't have any interest in them. <g> But I would think it would make it
more fair if a spellcaster couldn't float over a warrior and blast him,
while the warrior vainly swings at the air.

>>If I were king....
You would only be able to engage in melee combat while levitating (no
balance for archery, too much concentration for spellcasting)<<

That makes sense to me!

Paralto of Povar
